NegativeAdjectives.definition: out in the open or vulnerable

PositiveAdjectives.definition: out of sight or other forms of detection
peak or the greatest of its type
visibly stressed or worn from hard work

NegativeVerbs.definition: to significantly increase hostility, often by authority figures
to be actively harranged by authority figures
to inform on others to their competitors or enemies

PositiveVerbs.definition: to hide from detection or surveillance
to forcibly extract information from a person or system
to connect to a computer system for products, services, or information

NegativeObjectNouns.definition: a firearm whose ammunition resembles many small arrows or needles
intrusion countermeasure systems - hacking resistant software or electronics

NegativePersonNouns.definition: an informer to the enemy or competition

PositiveObjectNouns.definition: a vehicle used primarily for smuggling
mixed intrusion methodical executable - software that often succeeds at hacking low-order systems
material or electronic that interferes with infrared security systems

PositivePersonNouns.definition: a forger specialising in identity hashes
a reliable friend or family member
a member of an illegal organisation of community protectors, often riddled with tattoos

PlotKeywords.name: Federation Agency for the Welfare of Public Opinion
